title: New strains of hepatitis C found in Africa

title_detail.value: New strains of hepatitis C found in Africa

summary: The largest population study of hepatitis C in Africa has found three new strains of the virus circulating in the general population in sub-Saharan Africa. The discovery suggests certain antiviral drugs used in the West may be less effective against these strains, and local clinical trials of patients are urgently needed. The study could inform hepatitis C vaccine development and assist the World Health Organization's aim of eliminating hepatitis C globally.
